qas.question: What term is the beginning of menstruation given?
How many years does regular ovulation follow menarche?
Do males or females appear physically mature before they are capable of reproduction?
What are two areas of the reproductive system that experience growth in females during puberty?

context: In females, changes in the primary sex characteristics involve growth of the <a3_0>uterus, vagina<a3_0/>, and other aspects of the reproductive system. <a0_0>Menarche<a0_0/>, the beginning of menstruation, is a relatively late development which follows a long series of hormonal changes. Generally, a girl is not fully fertile until several years after menarche, as regular ovulation follows menarche by about <a1_0>two years<a1_0/>. Unlike males, therefore, <a2_0>females<a2_0/> usually appear physically mature before they are capable of becoming pregnant.
